page.title: 13TRADE
page.content: Until twenty years ago the were two shops in the village. Then, until seven years ago, there was one. Then there was not one at all, but quite recently the local pub _ the King's Head _ has made a small shop in its lobby. Many families make a weekly shopping trip to the big supermarkets in Hastings. If the own a freezer cabinet, and many do, this one trip may be enough. The nearest shops, banks and post office are at Rye, three miles away, and this is the usual shopping centre. The market in Rye on Thursdays is also popular. Most people go there by car; a few use the buses. The milkman delivers daily or on alternate days. He also brings soft drinks, bread and potatoes. A 'mobile shop' comes once a week. The ice_cream van comes twice. Three people sell produce at their gates.
